4.question: List the two major transmission patterns of HIV/AIDS globally.
answer: Pattern I: Seen in developed countries — mainly among homosexual/bisexual men and intravenous drug users, with limited heterosexual spread and near elimination of blood-borne transmission.
Pattern II: Seen in Africa, Caribbean, and Asia — mainly through heterosexual, perinatal, and blood/product transmission.

15.question: List the laboratory diagnostic tests for HIV.
answer: Antibody tests — ELISA, Rapid test, Western blot (confirmatory)
Antigen detection — Viral culture, DNA PCR, RNA PCR (Viral load, most sensitive)

16.question: List the four main classes of antiretroviral drugs or give examples of each.
answer: Reverse Transcriptase Inhibitors (RTIs): NRTIs — Zidovudine, Lamivudine, Stavudine, Abacavir; NNRTIs — Nevirapine, Efavirenz, Delaviridine; NTRTIs — Tenofovir

17.question: Explain the mechanism of action of the main antiretroviral drug classes.
answer: NNRTIs — bind to reverse transcriptase and inhibit its function
PIs — inhibit protease enzyme preventing viral assembly
Entry inhibitors — prevent viral fusion and entry
Integrase inhibitors — block integration of viral DNA into host genome
CCR5 antagonists — block viral attachment to T-cells

18.question: List the first-line, second-line, or third-line drugs for HIV management in Nigeria.
answer: First line: Two NRTIs + one NNRTI (Zidovudine, Lamivudine, Stavudine, Nevirapine, Efavirenz). Dolutegravir now added due to resistance
Second and third line: Selected based on resistance profiles

19.question: Describe the preventive therapies for HIV-positive individuals.

Cotrimoxazole Preventive Therapy (CPT): Used to prevent secondary bacterial and parasitic infections

21.question: List the main preventive measures against HIV/AIDS.
answer: General health promotion — health education and universal precautions
Specific protection — prevention of mother-to-child transmission (PMTCT) and post-exposure prophylaxis (PEP)
